repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits.

summary.p: Orientalists papers collected. Various papers of various format hinged or pasted on pages, bound in one volume.

The volume contains:
f1-f36: Devanāgāri syllabary printed with fonts. 9 quires pasted on the page; continuous foliation from one quire to the other; verso blank.
f37-f38: 2 poems in Devanāgāri, with Roma transcription, translation in ?, and French abstract.
f39-f40: a Grantha syllabary.
f41: note on Tamil grammar.
f42: list of Tamil words (Tamil in Tamil script, Tamil in Roman transcription, French translation). Written recto-verso.
f43: list of Tamil words (French translation, Tamil in Roman transcription). Written recto-verso.
f44-f62: list of Tamil words (Tamil in Roman transcription, Tamil in Tamil script, French translation and explanation). Some written recto-verso.
f63: Issue of Qasid E Madras, 10th March 1855.
f64: visiting card of Charles d'Ochoa, with notes in Indic script
f65: letter of Garcin de Tassy addressed to Charles d'Ochoa in Bombay, 4th May 1844.
f66: letter certifying the bad health of Charles d'Ochoa. Signed by the staff surgeon, Poonah, 4th August 1844.
f67: Quelques renseignements sur le peuple des Batta’s en Sumatra by Oscar de Kessel
f68: Tamil syllabary.
f69: Traduction en langue Tamoul de l’arrêté qui abolit le commerce des esclaves à Pondichéry
f70: bilingual text (French and Tamil) on heritage rules.
f71: Tamil text in Tamil script, Tamil transcription, and translation.
f72-f76: list of Tamil words (Tamil in Tamil script, French translation). Written recto-verso.
f77: Discours de M. Lescallier à l’assemblée coloniale, traduit en langue tamoul, 17th December 1792. 3 folios with Tamil pagination 1-5.
f78: illustration, seemingly from a cave at Ellora.

collation.desc: 78 folios = Orientalists Papers:. Arabic library foliation 1-78.

binding.p: Hard paper covers, marbled on the outer faces.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See handwritten addition, f. 1r, no. 941..

text.body:
Caractères Dêvanagri gravés par de la congrégation de la propagande a transporter à l’imprimerie de la République à Paris
Scène du
Jeune mariée ignorante femme ne comprend pas ce que on lui dit. L'homme cherche à lui faire connaitre à elle l'amour comme donner. Elle honte à cel.
alphabet Samskroutam
La Suite des Syllabes Grandam
N° 10
fragment tamoul, remis par M. le Baron L'Escallier, à la bibliothèque impériale, au mois de février 1811. {siganture}
page 1
17 Dec. 1792. Discours de M. Lescallier à l’assemblée coloniale, traduit en langue tamoul.

ṟaik kaṭṭuppāṭu veyyum
